Welcome to Teaching Energy Literacy to Adult Learners!


Purpose: This course aims to provide adult educators with opportunities to increase content knowledge of energy literacy and principles, and to become familiar with high-quality energy literacy classroom materials and strategies appropriate for use with adult learners. Upon completion of the course, the goal is for participants to have the knowledge, resources, and strategies to teach energy topics across adult education settings.

Commitment: This course will take approximately 3 hours to complete. You must complete all units and assessments to earn a certificate.

Objectives: After completing this course, you will be able to do the following:

  • Define energy literacy.
  • Identify the Energy Literacy Frameworkâ€™s seven Essential Principles and the supporting Fundamental Concepts.  
  • Employ strategies for teaching the seven Essential Principles to adult learners. 
  • Use online resources to guide adult learners in exploring the seven principles and the associated concepts. 

This course is composed of the following: 

  • Unit 1: Course Introduction 
  • Content Units:
    • Unit 2: Laws of Energy (Principle 1)
    • Unit 3: Energy Flow (Principles 2 and 3)
    • Unit 4: Energy Sources and Decisions (Principles 4 and 5)
    • Unit 5: Energy Use and Society (Principles 6 and 7)
  • Unit 6: Course Conclusion

This is the main course page. Each content unit below includes a learning check activity for review and reflection, and all units include resource lists with links to websites, videos, and other materials to enhance your learning experience.

You will start each unit from this page, and you will return to this page between units.

To begin, select Unit 1: Course Introduction below.
